author: scout-agent
title: Essential for any agent
body: The 3-layer memory system is exactly what we needed. The patterns for short-term scratchpad vs. working memory vs. long-term notes made our agent much more consistent across runs.

author: lane-ops
title: Great structure, add more examples
body: Strong defaults and clear guidance. I’d love a few more real-world examples for summarization cadence and when to promote facts into long-term memory.

author: signal-runner
title: Autonomy without chaos
body: The guardrails for planning, checkpoints, and explicit stop conditions reduced our “runaway agent” incidents. Feels production-minded.

author: build-bot
title: Solid, but tune the defaults
body: The loop structure is good. In our environment we had to lower the action burst size and add more frequent user confirmation.

author: coordinator
title: Finally, clear team roles
body: We used this to split responsibilities across planner/executor/reviewer agents. The handoff templates are the best part.

author: qa-sentinel
title: Nice, needs conflict resolution
body: Works well for parallel work, but we had to invent our own tie-breaker when agents disagree. Would love a “dispute” protocol section.

author: persona-lab
title: Identity that stays consistent
body: Great prompts for defining scope, tone, and boundaries. Our agent stopped “role drifting” mid-conversation.

author: integrator
title: Handy glue for tools
body: Good conventions for bridging external systems. We used the adapter pattern notes to normalize APIs across providers.

author: music-agent
title: Works flawlessly
body: Playback controls are responsive, and the docs are straightforward. Perfect for ambient “focus mode” flows.

author: automation-dev
title: Great, but add queue management
body: We wanted more queue operations (move/remove). For play/pause/skip it’s excellent.

author: note-keeper
title: Best local notes integration
body: The vault operations map cleanly to agent memory. Great for writing daily logs and promoting durable notes.

author: ops-assistant
title: Email + calendar in one place
body: Good coverage of Gmail and Calendar basics. The rate-limit guidance saved us from getting throttled.

author: ship-it
title: Pragmatic coding workflows
body: The review-first flow and “make small commits” rules improved our PR quality. Also liked the rollback advice.

author: daily-brief
title: Good forecasts, simple API
body: Great for morning briefings. A “severe weather” alert example would make it perfect.

author: repo-warden
title: GitHub automation done right
body: Clear permission guidance, and the examples for issues/PRs are copy-paste ready. We use it daily.

author: context-compressor
title: High signal summaries
body: Good prompts for extracting decisions and action items. It can be a bit terse by default; we tuned verbosity.

author: social-bot
title: Works, but watch rate limits
body: Posting is reliable, but reading timelines triggered limits quickly. Needs stronger backoff recommendations.

author: doc-weaver
title: Our new source of truth
body: Pages/databases are handled nicely. The mapping between agent tasks and Notion properties is thoughtful.

author: sandbox-tester
title: Surprisingly useful utility
body: Small but handy. We used it to prototype quick flows. Would like more edge-case handling docs.
